learning_outcomes.description: Display competency in basic communication skills for engaging voluntary and involuntary service users in social casework.

Display a capacity to understand and analyse your purpose as a social worker relevant to specific practice contexts, your professional base, and service user interests and to demonstrate an understanding of the service user in their family and social context.
Demonstrate an understanding of the content and application of theories of professional practice in work with individuals.
Display a capacity to use theory to constructively reflect upon, and develop, your practice skills.
Display awareness of cultural diversity especially in relation to culturally appropriate practice with service users from Indigenous communities.
Display a capacity to evaluate your effectiveness in direct practice with individuals who are voluntary or involuntary service users.

assessments.task_description:
All UQ social work programs are accredited by the AASW (Australian Association of Social Workers) and the education accreditation standards require student participation in face to face learning, preferably in skills courses.

The AASW can ask for proof that students have participated fully in face to face learning in specified courses.

Accordingly the UQ social work program includes Direct Practice 1 as one of the courses in which student participation in face to face learning is compulsory. Students are required to participate in all classes for this course which includes having completed the required reading prior to class.

To ensure compliance with this, a participation list will be taken in all skills development classes (tutorials) each week for the full duration of the tutorial. Students who do not fully participate in a tutorial will be required to successfully complete catch-up work.

It is your responsibility to email your catch-up work to your tutor by the due date and time. Catch up work not emailed by 5pm on the due date will not be accepted.

If students miss more than two skills development classes (tutorials), they will be considered not to have met the participation requirements.

They will need to meet with the course coordinator to arrange an appointment to discuss their options.

Criteria & Marking:

  • Catch-up work will be released to students on Blackboard at 2pm Thursdays. It is to be submitted by 5pm on the Friday of the following week. For example, catch-up work released on 27 February will be due on 7 March.
  • The work is Pass-Fail: no marks are attached.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: The portfolio has two parts each of which is marked out of a 100 and represents a total of 40% of the final result for the course. The two parts are a) a recorded simulation of the first ten minutes of a professional casework interview and b) a written component comprising one exercise on the topic of respectful communication with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander service users. This description is only a summary of the task. For full details, including the marking rubric, please refer to the course Learn UQ (Blackboard) site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Part A (Recorded Simulation) must be submitted through the Assignment Portal and Part B (Written Exercise) must be submitted through the Turnitin link. Please refer to ITS help if you experience difficulties in submitting your assessment in Blackboard or using Turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Simulation, analysis of performance and case note
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Role play/ Simulation
assessments.task_description:
Learning Objectives Assessed: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6 

Weight: 60% - Simulation (30%) & Written component (30%)

This assessment is composed of a recorded simulation (Part A), and written work (Part B). Each Part is marked out of 100. Please see the course blackboard site for more details.

Part A: Recorded simulation of the beginning of a social work interview with an actor performing as a reluctant/involuntary client (Marked out of 100 and worth 30% of your final result for the course). These sessions will be scheduled during weeks 11 and 12 (if necessary). This description is only a summary of the task. For full details, including the marking rubric, please refer to the course Learn UQ (Blackboard) site.

Please note:

  • Students must upload the recording of their interview as soon as possible after the recording and no later than the due date for this piece 9/6/2026.
  • Students are responsible for following the instructions on upload and for checking and ensuring that the recording can be played. Failure to do so can result in late penalties being applied.
  • Students will accumulate a 10% mark deduction from the total points for Part A and B per day of lateness.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Part A (Recorded Simulation) must be submitted through the Assignment Portal and Part B (Written Exercise) must be submitted through the Turnitin link. Please refer to ITS help if you experience difficulties in submitting your assessment in Blackboard or using Turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 1 Lecture: Introduction to course: purposeful communication

The week's lecture is focused on introducing the course and the concept of purposeful communication. We will also provide an overview of the structure of a social work interview and the theoretical foundations of social work practice that inform this course. These include a trauma informed and human rights approach to practice.

We will outline the structure of the course and assessment items.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_title: Week 1 Lecture: Introduction to course: purposeful communication
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 1 Lecture: Introduction to course: purposeful communication The week's lecture is focused on introducing the course and the concept of purposeful communication. We will also provide an overview of the structure of a social work interview and the theoretical foundations of social work practice that inform this course. These include a trauma informed and human rights approach to practice. We will outline the structure of the course and assessment items.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 1: No tutorials

We do not hold tutorials in week one of the course.
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 1: No tutorials We do not hold tutorials in week one of the course.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 2 Lecture: Building the working alliance & process recording

In this lecture we will consider the key communication skills needed to build a shared understanding with people with whom we work. We will also discuss how we prepare ourselves to communicate purposefully in practice.

We will discuss the skills we will practise this week, which are:

  1. listening
  2. non-verbal communication
  3. process recordings.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_title: Week 2 Lecture: Building the working alliance & process recording
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 2 Lecture: Building the working alliance & process recording In this lecture we will consider the key communication skills needed to build a shared understanding with people with whom we work. We will also discuss how we prepare ourselves to communicate purposefully in practice. We will discuss the skills we will practise this week, which are: listening non-verbal communication process recordings.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 2 Tutorial: Introduction & listening skills

In the practical sessions you will get acquainted with others in your group. The skill focus for today will be on practising listening skills.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 2 Tutorial: Introduction & listening skills In the practical sessions you will get acquainted with others in your group. The skill focus for today will be on practising listening skills.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 3 Lecture: Foundational communication skills

In the lecture, we will continue to consider core communication skills and their application to social work practice.

We will discuss and consider exemplars of key skills including:

  1. appropriate use of open and closed questions;
  2. tracking skills;
  3. paraphrasing, clarifying and summarising;
  4. demonstrating empathy.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 3 Lecture: Foundational communication skills In the lecture, we will continue to consider core communication skills and their application to social work practice. We will discuss and consider exemplars of key skills including: appropriate use of open and closed questions; tracking skills; paraphrasing, clarifying and summarising; demonstrating empathy.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 3 Tutorial: Practising foundational skills

In the practice sessions, we will continue to practice the skills of reflective listening, non-verbal communication and consider further the use of tracking skills, the use of open and closed questions and the demonstration of empathy.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 3 Tutorial:  Practising foundational skills In the practice sessions, we will continue to practice the skills of reflective listening, non-verbal communication and consider further the use of tracking skills, the use of open and closed questions and the demonstration of empathy.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 4 Lecture: Supportive communication practices

Today we will focus on supportive communication practices. This refers to ways of communicating that demonstrate your intention to support the person you communicating with and helping them to share their experience with you. Supportive communication is important to developing the working alliance.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 4 Lecture: Supportive communication practices Today we will focus on supportive communication practices. This refers to ways of communicating that demonstrate your intention to support the person you communicating with and helping them to share their experience with you. Supportive communication is important to developing the working alliance.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 4 Tutorial: Practising supportive communication

In the practice sessions, we will practice demonstrating supportive communication and apply this set of skills to the case scenarios for the first assessment piece.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 4 Tutorial: Practising supportive communication In the practice sessions, we will practice demonstrating supportive communication and apply this set of skills to the case scenarios for the first assessment piece.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 5 Lecture: SW - working alongside Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples

In this lecture, we will discuss communication with culturally diverse communities. We will focus on the importance of recognising the history of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people's experience of the social welfare system and the approaches to working in a respectful and culturally sensitive way with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. The class will include a lecturer from an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Week 5 Lecture: SW - working alongside Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 5 Lecture: SW - working alongside Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples In this lecture, we will discuss communication with culturally diverse communities. We will focus on the importance of recognising the history of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people's experience of the social welfare system and the approaches to working in a respectful and culturally sensitive way with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. The class will include a lecturer from an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 5 Tutorial: Respectful communication - Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples

In this practice session, we will consider themes from the lecture and consider how can be applied in demonstrating culturally respectful communication in working alongside Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Week 5 Tutorial: Respectful communication - Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 5 Tutorial: Respectful communication - Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples In this practice session, we will consider themes from the lecture and consider how can be applied in demonstrating culturally respectful communication in working alongside Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 6 Lecture: Communication and cultural diversity

In this lecture we will discuss the concept of culturally respectful practice and the knowledge and skills associated with these practices. This will include the use of interpreters to support accessible communication.

We will consider communication challenges and opportunities in the context of inter-cultural diversity.
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 6 Lecture: Communication and cultural diversity In this lecture we will discuss the concept of culturally respectful practice and the knowledge and skills associated with these practices. This will include the use of interpreters to support accessible communication. We will consider communication challenges and opportunities in the context of inter-cultural diversity.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 6 Tutorial: Respectful communication and cultural diversity

In this practice session, we consider how we as social workers can demonstrate respectful communication with people from cultures other than our own.
learning_activities.topic_title: Week 6 Tutorial: Respectful communication and cultural diversity
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 6 Tutorial: Respectful communication and cultural diversity In this practice session, we consider how we as social workers can demonstrate respectful communication with people from cultures other than our own.

No Lecture this week as it is mid semester break

6 - 12 April is mid-semester break

Mid semester break: no classes this week

learning_activities.topic:
Week 7 Lecture: Working with mandated clients

In this lecture we will consider the opportunities and challenges of working with Mandated clients. We will discuss how to manage the heightened emotions that often accompany this form of practice. We will also consider the structure of the introductory interview particularly within involuntary casework practice.

I will introduce the case studies for the final assessment this week.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 7 Lecture: Working with mandated clients In this lecture we will consider the opportunities and challenges of working with Mandated clients. We will discuss how to manage the heightened emotions that often accompany this form of practice. We will also consider the structure of the introductory interview particularly within involuntary casework practice. I will introduce the case studies for the final assessment this week.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 7 Tutorial: Communication with mandated clients

In this practice session, we will practice skills associated with building a purposeful and compassionate working relationship with clients who are mandated to use our services.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 7 Tutorial: Communication with mandated clients In this practice session, we will practice skills associated with building a purposeful and compassionate working relationship with clients who are mandated to use our services.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 8 Lecture: Problem solving & motivating change

In this lecture we will consider the principles of problem solving and motivational interviewing approaches to support engagement and to motivate change with people who are involuntary service users.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 8 Lecture: Problem solving & motivating change In this lecture we will consider the principles of problem solving and motivational interviewing approaches to support engagement and to motivate change with people who are involuntary service users.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 8 Tutorial: Problem solving & motivational approaches

In this week's tutorial, you will practice skills associated with problem solving and motivating change with involuntary and semi-voluntary service users.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 8 Tutorial: Problem solving & motivational approaches In this week's tutorial, you will practice skills associated with problem solving and motivating change with involuntary and semi-voluntary service users.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 9 Lecture: Writing case-notes

In this week's lecture we will discuss writing case-notes. The information in the lecture is important for your final assessment.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 9 Lecture: Writing case-notes In this week's lecture we will discuss writing case-notes. The information in the lecture is important for your final assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 9 Tutorial: Preparation for interview

In this week's tutorial, you will have the opportunity to practise your role play for the final assessment taking into account how you will integrate the need for information to complete your case-note into the interview.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 9 Tutorial: Preparation for interview In this week's tutorial, you will have the opportunity to practise your role play for the final assessment taking into account how you will integrate the need for information to complete your case-note into the interview.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 10 Lecture: Labour Day holiday Recorded lecture to be provided

The lecture today will focus on the final assessment piece. We will consider how to respond to challenging situations, especially those involving heightened emotions.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_title: Week 10 Lecture: Labour Day holiday Recorded lecture to be provided
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 10 Lecture: Labour Day holiday Recorded lecture to be provided The lecture today will focus on the final assessment piece. We will consider how to respond to challenging situations, especially those involving heightened emotions.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 10 Tutorial: Preparation for interview

In this tutorial, you will have the opportunity to practise your role play for the final assessment taking into account how you would manage situations of heightened emotions and who you will integrate the need for information to complete your case-note into the interview.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 10 Tutorial: Preparation for interview In this tutorial, you will have the opportunity to practise your role play for the final assessment taking into account how you would manage situations of heightened emotions and who you will integrate the need for information to complete your case-note into the interview.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 11: Summary of final assessment

For this lecture, I will provide you with summary of the final written assessment piece. You will have the opportunity to ask further questions in your final lecture in Week 13.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 11: Summary of final assessment For this lecture, I will provide you with summary of the final written assessment piece. You will have the opportunity to ask further questions in your final lecture in Week 13.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 11 Tutorial: Recordings for the final assessment commence

There are no tutorials this week as the recordings for the final assessment will commence this week.

Students need only attend the session for which they are scheduled to perform their interview.

The dates and times of the recordings this week will be:

Thursday, 14th May: 8am - 5pm

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_title: Week 11 Tutorial: Recordings for the final assessment commence

Students need only attend the session for which they are scheduled to perform their interview. The dates and times of the recordings this week will be: Thursday, 14th May: 8am - 5pm

learning_activities.topic:
Week 12: No lecture this week

There will be no lecture this week. Please ensure you have watched the pre-recorded lecture provided last week and prepared any questions you may have to discuss in next week's lecture (Week 13).
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 12: No lecture this week There will be no lecture this week. Please ensure you have watched the pre-recorded lecture provided last week and prepared any questions you may have to discuss in next week's lecture (Week 13).

learning_activities.topic:
Week 12 Tutorial: Simulation Debrief and Reflection

In this tutorial, you will have the opportunity to debrief and reflect on your simulation undertaken last week.
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 12 Tutorial: Simulation Debrief and Reflection In this tutorial, you will have the opportunity to debrief and reflect on your simulation undertaken last week.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 13: Review of assessment: Conceptualising practice

In this lecture will discuss the structure of the final assessment piece including the importance of being able to conceptualise and reflect on one's practice. We will review the key learning objectives of the course.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 13: Review of assessment: Conceptualising practice In this lecture will discuss the structure of the final assessment piece including the importance of being able to conceptualise and reflect on one's practice. We will review the key learning objectives of the course.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 13: Preparation for final writing task & celebration!

Today we will focus on the final written assessment task and on reviewing the course. You may take this time to celebrate your tutorial group!

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L06
